abstract: An adviser to the bloc's highest court said some restrictions should be placed on the use of brand names by rivals as keywords to generate Internet search ads.
snippet: An adviser to the bloc's highest court said some restrictions should be placed on the use of brand names by rivals as keywords to generate Internet search ads.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — An adviser to the highest European Union court recommended Thursday that some restrictions be placed on the rights of advertisers to use the names of rivals as keywords to generate sponsored links on Internet search engines.

headline.main: Advertisers in Europe May Face Limits in Use of Keywords
headline.print_headline: Advertisers in Europe May Face Limits in Use of Keywords
